intro: Stylidium glandulosissimum, commonly known as the glandular spurred orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow with a distinctive spur, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Stylidium glandulosissimum is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
